types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: ArticleStatus
types.description: The status of the syndicated article

types.name: Author
types.description: Information about an Author of an article or some content

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique id for that Author

fields.name: name
fields.description: Display name

fields.name: url
fields.description: A url to that Author's site

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: BulletedListElement
types.description: Row in a bulleted (unordered list)

fields.name: content
fields.description: Row in a list.

fields.name: level
fields.description: Zero-indexed level, for handling nested lists.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: CachedImage
types.description: A requested image that is cached and has the requested image parameters

fields.name: id
fields.description: Id of the image that matches the ID from the requested options

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL of the cached image

fields.name: width
fields.description: Width of the cached image

fields.name: height
fields.description: Height of the cached image

types.name: CachedImageInput
types.description: Set of parameters that will be used to change an image

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Id of the image in the returned result set

inputFields.name: qualityPercentage
inputFields.description: Quality of the image in whole percentage, 100 = full, quality 50 = half quality

inputFields.name: width
inputFields.description: Width of the image

inputFields.name: height
inputFields.description: Height of the image

inputFields.name: fileType
inputFields.description: File type of the requested image

fields.name: language
fields.description:
note that language is *not* being used as locale - only to specify the
language of the collection.

fields.name: IABParentCategory
fields.description:
We will never return child categories in this type, so there's no need to
specify `IABParentCategory` here. The basic `IABCategory` is sufficient.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: CollectionLanguage
types.description: valid language codes for collections

enumValues.name: DE
enumValues.description: German

enumValues.name: EN
enumValues.description: English

types.name: CollectionPartnership
types.description:
If a collection was made in partnership with an external company, this
entity will hold all required info about that partnership.

types.name: CollectionPartnershipType
types.description: Type and enums related to Collections made in partnership with a company.

inputFields.name: language
inputFields.description: if not provided, or if an unsupported language is requested, defaults to `en`

fields.name: fromPartner
fields.description: if True, the story is provided by a partner and should be displayed as such

types.name: CorpusItem
types.description: Represents an item that is in the Corpus and its associated manually edited metadata.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The GUID that is stored on an approved corpus item

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL of the Approved Item.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the Approved Item.

fields.name: excerpt
fields.description: The excerpt of the Approved Item.

fields.name: language
fields.description: What language this item is in. This is a two-letter code, for example, 'EN' for English.

fields.name: publisher
fields.description: The name of the online publication that published this story.

fields.name: imageUrl
fields.description: The image URL for this item's accompanying picture.

fields.name: image
fields.description: The image for this item's accompanying picture.

fields.name: authors
fields.description: The author names and sort orders associated with this CorpusItem.

fields.name: topic
fields.description: The topic associated with the Approved Item.

types.name: CorpusItemAuthor
types.description: An author associated with a CorpusItem.

types.name: CorpusLanguage
types.description: Valid language codes for curated corpus items.

enumValues.name: DE
enumValues.description: German

enumValues.name: EN
enumValues.description: English

fields.name: corpusItem
fields.description: Content meta data.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Clients should include this id in the `corpus_recommendation` Snowplow entity for impression, content_open, and engagement events related to this recommendation. This id is different across users, across requests, and across corpus items. The recommendation-api service associates metadata with this id to join and aggregate recommendations in our data warehouse.

fields.name: reason
fields.description: Reason why this CorpusItem is recommended to the user, or null if no reason is available.

types.name: CorpusSlate
types.description: This is the same as Slate but in this type all recommendations are backed by CorpusItems. This means that the editorial team has editorial control over the items served by this endpoint.

fields.name: recommendations
fields.description: Recommendations for the current request context.

fields.name: headline
fields.description: The display headline for the slate. Surface context may be required to render determine what to display. This will depend on if we connect the copy to the Surface, SlateExperiment, or Slate.

fields.name: id
fields.description: UUID

fields.name: recommendationReasonType
fields.description: Indicates the main type of reason why recommendations are included in this slate, or null if none is available.

fields.name: subheadline
fields.description: A smaller, secondary headline that can be displayed to provide additional context on the slate.

fields.name: moreLink
fields.description: Link to a page where the user can explore more recommendations similar to this slate, or null if no link is provided.

types.name: CorpusSlateLineup
types.description: A collection of slates.

fields.name: slates
fields.description: Slates.

fields.name: id
fields.description: UUID

types.name: CreateHighlightInput
types.description: Input for creating a new User-highlighted passage on a SavedItem.

inputFields.name: quote
inputFields.description:
The full text of the highlighted passage. Used as a fallback for
rendering highlight if the patch fails.

inputFields.name: patch
inputFields.description:
Patch string generated by 'DiffMatchPatch' library, serialized
into text via `patch_toText` method.
Format is similar to UniDiff but is character-based.
The patched text depends on version. For example, the version 2
patch surrounds the highlighted text portion with a pair of
sentinel tags: '<pkt_tag_annotation></pkt_tag_annotation>'
Reference: https://github.com/google/diff-match-patch

inputFields.name: version
inputFields.description: Annotation data version

inputFields.name: itemId
inputFields.description: The ID of the Item that should be annotated in the User's list

inputFields.name: note
inputFields.description: Optional note generated by User

types.name: CuratedInfo
types.description: This type represents the information we need on a curated item.

fields.name: image
fields.description: The image for this item's accompanying picture.

types.name: Date
types.description: A date in the YYYY-MM-DD format.

types.name: DateString
types.description: A String representing a date in the format of `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss`

inputFields.name: savedItemId
inputFields.description: The id of the SavedItem from which to delete a Tag association

inputFields.name: tagIds
inputFields.description: The ids of the Tag to disassociate from the SavedItem

types.name: DomainMetadata
types.description: Metadata from a domain, originally populated from ClearBit

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the domain (e.g., The New York Times)

fields.name: logo
fields.description: Url for the logo image

fields.name: logoGreyscale
fields.description: Url for the greyscale logo image

types.name: FunctionalBoostField
types.description: Input field to boost the score of an elasticsearch document based on a specific field and value

inputFields.name: field
inputFields.description: Field to evaluate for boosting

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: Field value to evaluate

inputFields.name: factor
inputFields.description: A float number to boost the score by

inputFields.name: operation
inputFields.description: The mathematical operation to use for boosting

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Highlight
types.description: A User-highlighted passage on a SavedItem

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID for this Highlight annotation

fields.name: quote
fields.description:
The full text of the highlighted passage. Used as a fallback for
rendering highlight if the patch fails.

fields.name: patch
fields.description:
Patch string generated by 'DiffMatchPatch' library, serialized
into text via `patch_toText` method. Use `patch_fromText` to
deserialize into an object that can be used by the DiffMatchPatch
library. Format is similar to UniDiff but is character-based.
The patched text depends on version. For example, the version 2
patch surrounds the highlighted text portion with a pair of
sentinel tags: '<pkt_tag_annotation></pkt_tag_annotation>'
Reference: https://github.com/google/diff-match-patch

fields.name: version
fields.description: Version number for highlight data specification

fields.name: _createdAt
fields.description: When the Highlight was created

fields.name: _updatedAt
fields.description: When the highlight was last updated

fields.name: note
fields.description: Highlight Note associated with this Highlight

fields.name: text
fields.description: User entered text

fields.name: _createdAt
fields.description: When the HighlightNote was created

fields.name: _updatedAt
fields.description: When the HighlightNote was last updated

types.name: IABCategory
types.description: Interactive Advertising Bureau Category - these are used on clients to serve relevant ads

types.name: Image
types.description: An image that is keyed on URL

fields.name: url
fields.description: The url of the image

fields.name: width
fields.description: The determined width of the image at the url

fields.name: height
fields.description: The determined height of the image at the url

fields.name: cachedImages
fields.description: Query to get a cached and modified set of images based on the image from the original url, images will be matched by the client assigned id value

fields.name: caption
fields.description: A caption or description of the image

fields.name: credit
fields.description: A credit for the image, typically who the image belongs to / created by

fields.name: imageId
fields.description: The id for placing within an Article View. {articleView.article} will have placeholders of <div id='RIL_IMG_X' /> where X is this id. Apps can download those images as needed and populate them in their article view.

fields.name: src
fields.description: Absolute url to the image

fields.name: targetUrl
fields.description: If the image is also a link, the destination url

types.name: ImageFileType
types.description: The image file type

enumValues.name: NO_IMAGES
enumValues.description: No images (v3 value is 0)

enumValues.name: HAS_IMAGES
enumValues.description: Contains images (v3 value is 1)

enumValues.name: IS_IMAGE
enumValues.description: Is an image (v3 value is 2)

types.name: Item
types.description:
The heart of Pocket
A url and meta data related to it.

fields.name: givenUrl
fields.description: key field to identify the Item entity in the Parser service

fields.name: collection
fields.description: If the item is a collection allow them to get the collection information

fields.name: itemId
fields.description:
The Item entity is owned by the Parser service.
We only extend it in this service to make this service's schema valid.
The key for this entity is the 'itemId'

fields.name: savedItem
fields.description: Helper property to identify if the given item is in the user's list

fields.name: normalUrl
fields.description:
A normalized value of the givenUrl.
It will look like a url but is not guaranteed to be a valid url, just a unique string that is used to eliminate common duplicates.
Item's that share a normal_url should be considered the same item. For example https://getpocket.com and http://getpocket.com will be considered the same since they both normalize to http://getpocket.com
This is technically the true identity of an item, since this is what the backend uses to tell if two items are the same.
However, for the clients to use this, they would all have to ship an implementation of the normalization function that the backend has exactly.
And even if it did that, some items, some of the earliest saves, use a legacy normalize function and the client would have no way to know when to use which normalizing function.

fields.name: ampUrl
fields.description: If available, the url to an AMP version of this article

fields.name: authors
fields.description: List of Authors involved with this article

fields.name: domain
fields.description: The domain, such as 'getpocket.com' of the {.resolved_url}

fields.name: domainMetadata
fields.description: Additional information about the item domain, when present, use this for displaying the domain name

fields.name: encoding
fields.description: The string encoding code of this item's web page

fields.name: excerpt
fields.description: A snippet of text from the article

fields.name: hasImage
fields.description: 0=no images, 1=contains images, 2=is an image

fields.name: hasVideo
fields.description: 0=no videos, 1=contains video, 2=is a video

fields.name: images
fields.description: Array of images within an article

fields.name: isArticle
fields.description: true if the item is an article

fields.name: isIndex
fields.description: true if the item is an index / home page, rather than a specific single piece of content

fields.name: mimeType
fields.description: The mime type of this item's web page

fields.name: resolvedId
fields.description: The item id of the resolved_url

fields.name: resolvedUrl
fields.description: If the givenUrl redirects (once or many times), this is the final url. Otherwise, same as givenUrl

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title as determined by the parser.

fields.name: topImageUrl
fields.description: The page's / publisher's preferred thumbnail image

fields.name: topImage
fields.description: The page's / publisher's preferred thumbnail image

fields.name: videos
fields.description: Array of videos within the item If the item is a video, this will likely just contain one video

fields.name: wordCount
fields.description: Number of words in the article

fields.name: dateResolved
fields.description: The date the parser resolved this item

fields.name: datePublished
fields.description: The date the article was published

fields.name: language
fields.description: The detected language of the article

fields.name: timeToRead
fields.description: How long it will take to read the article (TODO in what time unit? and by what calculation?)

fields.name: hasOldDupes
fields.description: Indicates that the item was stored via a different search_hash (using the old method), we'll need to look up a different id
fields.deprecationReason: Most new items use a new hash

fields.name: domainId
fields.description: The primary database id of the domain this article is from
fields.deprecationReason: Use a domain as the identifier instead

fields.name: originDomainId
fields.description: If a the domainId is a subdomain this is the primary domain id
fields.deprecationReason: Use a domain as the identifier instead

fields.name: responseCode
fields.description: The http response code of the given url

fields.name: contentLength
fields.description: The length in bytes of the content

fields.name: innerDomainRedirect
fields.description: Indicates if the text of the url is a redirect to another url

fields.name: loginRequired
fields.description: Indicates if the url requires a login

fields.name: usedFallback
fields.description: Indicates if the parser used fallback methods

fields.name: timeFirstParsed
fields.description: Date this item was first parsed in Pocket

fields.name: resolvedNormalUrl
fields.description: The resolved url, but ran through the normalized function

fields.name: article
fields.description:
The pocket HTML string of the article.
Note: Web and Android as of 3/4/2022 use the Article field, any improvements made
within MArticle for parsing will not be reflected in the article field.
When that happens, the clients will work to move to MArticle.

fields.name: marticle
fields.description: The Marticle format of the article, used by clients for native article view.

fields.name: syndicatedArticle
fields.description: If the item has a syndicated counterpart the syndication information

fields.name: highlights
fields.description: Keyword highlights from search

types.name: ItemHighlights
types.description: Elasticsearch highlights

types.name: ItemResult
types.description: Union type for items that may or may not be processed

types.name: Link
types.description: Web link

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL to send the user to when clicking on the link.

fields.name: text
fields.description: The link text displayed to the user.

fields.name: content
fields.description: Row in a list.

fields.name: level
fields.description: Zero-indexed level, for handling nested lists.

types.name: Markdown
types.description:
A string formatted with CommonMark markdown,
plus the strikethrough extension from GFM.
This Scalar is for documentation purposes; otherwise
not treated differently from String in the API.

fields.name: src
fields.description: Fallback is to use the images field in the Item entity

types.name: MarticleBlockquote
types.description: Content of a blockquote

fields.description: Markdown text content.

types.name: MarticleBulletedList
types.description: Content in a bulleted (unordered) list.

types.name: MarticleCodeBlock
types.description: A pre formatted text in the HTML content.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Content of a pre tag

fields.name: language
fields.description: Assuming the codeblock was a programming language, this field is used to identify it.

fields.name: content
fields.description: Always '---'; provided for convenience if building a markdown string

types.name: MarticleHeading
types.description: A heading in an article, with markdown formatting.

fields.name: content
fields.description: Heading text, in markdown.

fields.name: level
fields.description: Heading level. Restricted to values 1-6.

types.name: MarticleNumberedList
types.description: Content in a bulleted (unordered) list.

types.name: MarticleTable
types.description: Content in a table.

fields.name: html
fields.description: Raw HTML representation of the table.

types.name: MarticleText
types.description:
A section of the article's text content, in markdown.
A subset of gfm is supported. See README.md for more information.

fields.name: content
fields.description: Markdown text content. Typically, a paragraph.

types.name: Mutation
types.description: Default Mutation Type

fields.name: createSavedItemHighlights
fields.description: Create new highlight annotation(s). Returns the data for the created Highlight object(s).

fields.name: createSavedItemHighlightNote
fields.description: Create new highlight note. Returns the data for the created Highlight note.

fields.name: updateSavedItemHighlight
fields.description:
Update an existing highlight annotation, by its ID.
If the given highlight ID does not exist, will return error data
and the highlight will not be created.

fields.name: updateSavedItemHighlightNote
fields.description:
Update an existing highlight note, by its ID.
If the given highlight ID does not exist, will return error data
and the note will not be updated.

fields.name: deleteSavedItemHighlight
fields.description: Delete a highlight by its ID.

fields.name: deleteSavedItemHighlightNote
fields.description: Delete a highlight note by the Highlight ID.

fields.name: upsertSavedItem
fields.description:
Updates a SavedItem, undeletes and unarchives it, bringing it to the top of the user's list, if it exists
and creates it if it doesn't.

fields.name: updateSavedItemArchive
fields.description: Archives a SavedItem

fields.name: updateSavedItemUnArchive
fields.description: Unarchives a SavedItem

fields.name: updateSavedItemUnDelete
fields.description: Undo the delete operation for a SavedItem

fields.name: updateSavedItemFavorite
fields.description: Favorites a SavedItem

fields.name: updateSavedItemUnFavorite
fields.description: Unfavorites a SavedItem

fields.name: updateSavedItemTags
fields.description:
Set the Tags that are associated with a SavedItem.
Will replace any existing Tag associations on the SavedItem.
To remove all Tags from a SavedItem, use `updateSavedItemRemoveTags`.

fields.name: updateSavedItemRemoveTags
fields.description:
Removes all Tag associations from a SavedItem. Returns the
SavedItem that had its Tag associations cleared.
Note that if this operation results in a Tag having no associations
to a SavedItem, the Tag object will be deleted.

fields.name: deleteSavedItem
fields.description:
Deletes a SavedItem from the users list. Returns ID of the
deleted SavedItem

fields.name: createTags
fields.description: Creates user tags that a user can use to classify SavedItems

fields.name: updateTag
fields.description:
Updates a Tag (renames the tag), and returns the updated Tag.
If a Tag with the updated name already exists in the database, will
associate that Tag to all relevant SavedItems rather than creating
a duplicate Tag object.

fields.name: deleteTag
fields.description:
Deletes a Tag object. This is deletes the Tag and all SavedItem associations
(removes the Tag from all SavedItems). Returns ID of the deleted Tag.

fields.name: deleteSavedItemTags
fields.description:
Delete one or more tags from one or more SavedItems.
Note that if this operation results in a Tag having no associations
to a SavedItem, the Tag object will be deleted.

fields.name: createSavedItemTags
fields.description:
Add tags to the savedItems
Inputs a list of SavedItemTagsInput(ie. savedItemId and the list of tagName)
Returns the list of `SavedItem` for which the tags were added

fields.name: replaceSavedItemTags
fields.description:
Replaces the old tags associated with the savedItem to the new tag list
given in the entry
To remove all Tags from a SavedItem, use `updateSavedItemRemoveTags`.
Note: if there is a new tag name in the SavedItemTagsInput, then the tag record will be created
Inputs a list of SavedItemTagsInput(ie. savedItemId and list of tag names)
Returns the SavedItem for which the tags have been modified.

fields.name: refreshItemArticle
fields.description: Refresh an {Item}'s article content.

fields.name: updateUserRecommendationPreferences
fields.description: Updates user preferences for content recommendations across Pocket.

fields.name: updateUserEmail
fields.description:
update the email of the user for the given pocket userId. Request is made by
an authenticated user, and the userID is inferred from the request headers `userid`.

fields.name: deleteUser
fields.description: Deletes user information and their pocket data for the given pocket userId. Returns pocket userId.

fields.name: updateUserEmailByFxaId
fields.description:
update the email of the user for the given firefox account ID. Request
is made by a backend service. The `userid` in the headers should match
the FxA ID or else an authentication error will be thrown.

fields.name: deleteUserByFxaId
fields.description:
Deletes user information and their pocket data for the given firefox account ID.
Returns firefox account ID sent as the query parameter with the request.

types.name: NonNegativeInt
types.description: A positive integer number.

fields.name: content
fields.description: Row in a list

fields.name: level
fields.description: Zero-indexed level, for handling nested lists.

fields.name: index
fields.description: Numeric index. If a nested item, the index is zero-indexed from the first child.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about pagination in a connection.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

types.name: PageType
types.description:
Represents a type of page for /explore
Deprecated for SlateLineups

types.name: PaginationInput
types.description:
Pagination request. To determine which edges to return, the connection
evaluates the `before` and `after` cursors (if given) to filter the
edges, then evaluates `first`/`last` to slice the edges (only include a
value for either `first` or `last`, not both). If all fields are null,
by default will return a page with the first 30 elements.

inputFields.name: after
inputFields.description:
Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor.
The specified cursor is not included in the result.

inputFields.name: before
inputFields.description:
Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor.
The specified cursor is not included in the result.

inputFields.name: first
inputFields.description:
Returns the first _n_ elements from the list. Must be a non-negative integer.
If `first` contains a value, `last` should be null/omitted in the input.

inputFields.name: last
inputFields.description:
Returns the last _n_ elements from the list. Must be a non-negative integer.
If `last` contains a value, `first` should be null/omitted in the input.

fields.name: url
fields.description:
URL of the item that the user gave for the SavedItem
that is pending processing by parser

types.name: Query

Default root level query type. All authorization checks are done in these queries.
TODO: These belong in a seperate User Service that provides a User object (the user settings will probably exist there too)

fields.name: getCollections
fields.description: Retrievs a paged set of published Collections.

fields.name: getCollectionBySlug
fields.description: Retrieves a Collection by the given slug. The Collection must be published.

fields.name: collectionBySlug
fields.description: Retrieves a {Collection} by the given slug. The {Collection} must be published.

fields.name: surface
fields.description: This is a future improvement, not needed now.

fields.name: getUnleashAssignments
fields.description:
Returns a list of unleash toggles that are enabled for a given context.

For more details on this check out https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYS81h-DbQEWNLtK-ajLTylw454S32llPXUyBmDd5mU/edit# and https://getpocket.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/PE/pages/1191444582/Feature+Flags+-+Unleash

~ For each of the enabled unleash toggles (via https://featureflags.readitlater.com/api/client/features or an unleash sdk)
~ Check if the toggle is assigned/enabled for the provided {.context}
~ Add an {UnleashAssignment} representing it to this list
~ If no toggles are found, return an empty list

fields.name: unleashAssignments
fields.description:
Returns a list of unleash toggles that are enabled for a given context.

For more details on this check out https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYS81h-DbQEWNLtK-ajLTylw454S32llPXUyBmDd5mU/edit# and https://getpocket.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/PE/pages/1191444582/Feature+Flags+-+Unleash

~ For each of the enabled unleash toggles (via https://featureflags.readitlater.com/api/client/features or an unleash sdk)
~ Check if the toggle is assigned/enabled for the provided {.context}
~ Add an {UnleashAssignment} representing it to this list
~ If no toggles are found, return an empty list

fields.name: getItemByUrl
fields.description: Look up {Item} info by a url.

fields.name: getItemByItemId
fields.description: Look up {Item} info by ID.

fields.name: itemByUrl
fields.description: Look up {Item} info by a url.

fields.name: itemByItemId
fields.description: Look up {Item} info by ID.

fields.name: homeSlateLineup
fields.description: Under active development: Get ranked corpus slates and recommendations to deliver a unified Home experience.

fields.name: setupMomentSlate
fields.description: Get stories during Setup Moment onboarding that are personalized with user preferences provided during onboarding.
fields.deprecationReason: Setup Moment has been integrated into Home.

fields.name: recommendationPreferenceTopics
fields.description: List all topics that the user can express a preference for.

fields.name: listTopics
fields.description: List all available topics that we have recommendations for.
fields.deprecationReason: Use `getSlateLineup` with a specific SlateLineup instead.

fields.name: getSlate
fields.description: Request a specific `Slate` by id

args.name: slateId
args.description: The {Slate.id} of the slate to return

args.name: recommendationCount
args.description: Maximum number of recommendations to return in {Slate.recommendations}, defaults to 10

fields.deprecationReason: Please use queries specific to the surface ex. setMomentSlate. If a named query for your surface does not yet exit please reach out to the Data Products team and they will happily provide you with a named query.

fields.name: getSlateLineup
fields.description: Request a specific `SlateLineup` by id

args.name: slateLineupId
args.description: The {SlateLineup.id} of the SlateLineup to return

args.name: slateCount
args.description: Maximum number of slates to return in {SlateLineup.slates}, defaults to 8

args.name: recommendationCount
args.description: Maximum number of recommendations to return in {Slate.recommendations}, defaults to 10

fields.deprecationReason: Please use queries specific to the surface ex. setMomentSlate. If a named query for your surface does not yet exit please reach out to the Data Products team and they will happily provide you with a named query.

fields.name: getSyndicatedArticleBySlug
fields.description: Look up {SyndicatedArticle} by a slug.

fields.name: syndicatedArticleBySlug
fields.description: Look up the {SyndicatedArticle} by a slug

fields.name: user
fields.description: Get a user entity for an authenticated client

fields.name: userByToken
fields.description: Gets a user entity for a given access token

fields.name: userById
fields.description: Gets a user for a given ID, only admin/internal service credentials will be allowed to do this for IDs other then their own.

types.name: Recommendation
types.description: Represents a Recommendation from Pocket

fields.name: item
fields.description:
The Recommendation entity is owned by the Recommendation API service.
We extend it in this service to add an extra field ('curationInfo') to the Recommendation entity.
The key for this entity is the 'itemId' found within the Item entity which is owned by the Parser service.

fields.name: feedId
fields.description: The feed id from mysql that this item was curated from (if it was curated)

fields.name: itemId
fields.description:
The ID of the item this recommendation represents
TODO: Use apollo federation to turn this into an Item type.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A generated id from the Data and Learning team that represents the Recommendation

fields.name: feedItemId
fields.description: A generated id from the Data and Learning team that represents the Recommendation - Deprecated

fields.name: recSrc
fields.description: The source of the recommendation

fields.name: publisher
fields.description: The publisher of the item

fields.name: name
fields.description: A succinct name for the recommendation reason that can be displayed to the user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of reason for why the recommendation is made.

types.name: RecommendationReasonType
types.description: Reasons why recommendations are made. Focuses on client needs and is not exhaustive.

enumValues.name: POCKET_HITS
enumValues.description: Recommendations are sourced from the Pocket Hits newsletter.

enumValues.name: PREFERRED_TOPICS
enumValues.description: Recommendations that match the user's topic preferences are ranked higher.

types.name: RemoteEntity
types.description: Interface that all state based entities must implement

fields.name: id
fields.description:
For tags entity, id denotes the unique tag Id.
For savedItems, id denotes the itemId.
Along with the userId provided in the header, we will use id to fetch savedItems/tags for the user.

fields.name: _createdAt
fields.description: Unix timestamp of when the entity was created

fields.name: _updatedAt
fields.description: Unix timestamp of when the entity was last updated, if any property on the entity is modified this timestamp is set to the modified time

fields.name: _version
fields.description: Version of the entity, this will increment with each modification of the entity's field

fields.name: _deletedAt
fields.description: Unix timestamp of when the entity was deleted, 30 days after this date this entity will be HARD deleted from the database and no longer exist

types.name: SavedItem
types.description:
Represents a Pocket Item that a user has saved to their list.
(Said otherways, indicates a saved url to a users list and associated user specific information.)

fields.name: id
fields.description: Surrogate primary key. This is usually generated by clients, but will be generated by the server if not passed through creation

fields.name: annotations
fields.description: Annotations associated to this SavedItem

fields.name: url
fields.description: The url the user saved to their list

fields.name: isFavorite
fields.description: Helper property to indicate if the SavedItem is favorited

fields.name: favoritedAt
fields.description: Timestamp that the SavedItem became favorited, null if not favorited

fields.name: isArchived
fields.description: Helper property to indicate if the SavedItem is archived

fields.name: archivedAt
fields.description: Timestamp that the SavedItem became archied, null if not archived

fields.name: item
fields.description: Link to the underlying Pocket Item for the URL

fields.name: tags
fields.description: The Tags associated with this SavedItem

fields.name: suggestedTags
fields.description: The Suggested Tags associated with this SavedItem, if the user is not premium or there are none, this will be empty.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this SavedItem

fields.name: _createdAt
fields.description: Unix timestamp of when the entity was created

fields.name: _updatedAt
fields.description: Unix timestamp of when the entity was last updated, if any property on the entity is modified this timestamp is set to the modified time

fields.name: _version
fields.description: Version of the entity, this will increment with each modification of the entity's field

fields.name: _deletedAt
fields.description: Unix timestamp of when the entity was deleted, 30 days after this date this entity will be HARD deleted from the database and no longer exist

types.name: SavedItemAnnotations
types.description:
Container for all annotations associated to a SavedItem.
Can be extended when more types of annotations are added.

fields.name: highlights
fields.description: User-highlighted passages on a SavedItem

types.name: SavedItemConnection
types.description: The connection type for SavedItem.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: Identifies the total count of SavedItems in the connection.

types.name: SavedItemEdge
types.description: An edge in a connection.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The SavedItem at the end of the edge.

types.name: SavedItemsContentType
types.description: A SavedItem can be one of these content types

enumValues.name: VIDEO
enumValues.description: Item is a parsed article that contains videos

enumValues.name: ARTICLE
enumValues.description: Item is a parsed page can be opened in reader view

enumValues.name: IS_IMAGE
enumValues.description: Item is an image

enumValues.name: IS_VIDEO
enumValues.description: Item is a video

enumValues.name: HAS_VIDEO
enumValues.description: Item is a parsed article that contains videos

enumValues.name: IS_READABLE
enumValues.description: Item is a parsed page can be opened in reader view

enumValues.name: IS_EXTERNAL
enumValues.description: Item is an un-parsable page and will be opened externally

fields.name: searchHighlights
fields.description:
Highlighted snippets from fields in the search results
searchHighlights is a premium user feature. Not available for free search.

types.name: SavedItemSearchResultConnection
types.description: The connection type for SavedItem.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: Identifies the total count of items in the connection.

types.name: SavedItemSearchResultEdge
types.description: An edge in a connection.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge.

types.name: SavedItemsFilter
types.description: Input field for filtering a user's list

inputFields.name: updatedSince
inputFields.description: Optional, filter to get SavedItems updated since a unix timestamp

inputFields.name: isFavorite
inputFields.description: Optional, filter to get SavedItems that have been favorited

inputFields.name: isArchived
inputFields.description:
Optional, filter to get SavedItems that have been archived.
This field is deprecated. Use status instead.
TODO: Add deprecate tag once input field deprecation is enabled.
Ref: https://github.com/apollographql/federation/issues/912

inputFields.name: tagIds
inputFields.description: Optional, filter to get SavedItems associated to the specified Tag.

inputFields.name: tagNames
inputFields.description:
Optional, filter to get SavedItems associated to the specified Tag name.
To get untagged items, include the string '_untagged_'.

inputFields.name: isHighlighted
inputFields.description: Optional, filter to get SavedItems with highlights

inputFields.name: contentType
inputFields.description: Optional, filter to get SavedItems based on content type

inputFields.name: status
inputFields.description: Optional, filter to get user items based on status. Deprecated: use statuses instead.

inputFields.name: statuses
inputFields.description: Optional, filters to get user items based on multiple statuses (OR operator)

types.name: SavedItemsSort
types.description: Input to sort fetched SavedItems. If unspecified, defaults to CREATED_AT, ASC.

inputFields.name: sortBy
inputFields.description: The field by which to sort SavedItems

inputFields.name: sortOrder
inputFields.description: The order in which to sort SavedItems

types.name: SavedItemsSortBy
types.description: Enum to specify the sort by field (these are the current options, we could add more in the future)

types.name: SavedItemsSortOrder
types.description: Enum to specify the sort order of SavedItems fetched

types.name: SavedItemStatusFilter
types.description: Valid statuses a client may use to filter SavedItems

fields.name: savedItemId
fields.description: The ID of the SavedItem associated with the Tag

fields.name: tagId
fields.description: The ID of the Tag associated with the SavedItem

types.name: SavedItemTagsInput
types.description: Input field for setting all Tag associations on a SavedItem.

inputFields.name: savedItemId
inputFields.description: The SavedItem ID to associate Tags to

inputFields.name: tags
inputFields.description: The set of Tag names to associate to the SavedItem

types.name: SavedItemTagUpdateInput
types.description: Input field for setting all Tag associations on a SavedItem.

inputFields.name: savedItemId
inputFields.description: The SavedItem ID to associate Tags to

inputFields.name: tagIds
inputFields.description: The set of Tag IDs to associate to the SavedItem

types.name: SavedItemUpsertInput
types.description: Input field for upserting a SavedItem

inputFields.name: url
inputFields.description: The url to create/update the SavedItem with. (the url to save to the list)

inputFields.name: isFavorite
inputFields.description: Optional, create/update the SavedItem as a favorited item

inputFields.name: timestamp
inputFields.description: Optional, time that request was submitted by client epoch/unix time

types.name: SaveItemSearchHighlights
types.description: Elasticsearch highlights. Highlighted snippets from the following fields in the search results so clients can show users where the query matches are. Each field, if available, contains an array of html text snippets that contain a match to the search term. The matching text is wrapped in `` tags, e.g. ["Hiss at vacuum cleaner if it fits i sits"]

types.name: ScheduledSurface
types.description: Represents a surface that has scheduled items by day

fields.name: id
fields.description: Agreed on GUID that is from our shared data pocket confluence

fields.name: name
fields.description: Internal name of the surface

fields.name: items
fields.description: Subquery to get the ScheduledSurfaceItems to display to a user for a given date

types.name: ScheduledSurfaceItem
types.description:
A scheduled entry for an CorpusItem to appear on a Scheduled Surface.
For example, a story that is scheduled to appear on December 31st, 2021 on the Scheduled Surface in Firefox for the US audience.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A backend GUID that represents this scheduled run

fields.name: surfaceId
fields.description: Agreed on GUID that is from our shared data pocket confluence

fields.name: scheduledDate
fields.description: The date the item should run at

fields.name: corpusItem
fields.description: The curated item that should run

types.name: SearchFilter
types.description: Input filed for filtering items

inputFields.name: tags
inputFields.description: Optional fitler to get item with specific tags

inputFields.name: status
inputFields.description: Optional filter to get items in a specific state

inputFields.name: favorite
inputFields.description: Optional filter to get items that are favorited

inputFields.name: contentType
inputFields.description: Optional filter to items of a specific content type

inputFields.name: domain
inputFields.description:
Optional filter to get items that matches the domain
domain should be in the url format, e.g getpocket.com (or) list.getpocket.com

inputFields.name: isFavorite
inputFields.description: Optional, filter to get user items that have been favorited

inputFields.name: contentType
inputFields.description: Optional, filter to get SavedItems based on content type

inputFields.name: status
inputFields.description: Optional, filter to get user items based on status.

inputFields.name: domain
inputFields.description:
Optional filter to get items that matches the domain
domain should be in the url format, e.g getpocket.com (or) list.getpocket.com

types.name: SearchFunctionalBoostOperation
types.description:
Used to detemermine whether to add or multiply a document's score by the
functional boost factor

types.name: SearchHighlightField
types.description: Input field to get elasticsearch highlights of keywords

inputFields.name: field
inputFields.description: Field to highlight

inputFields.name: size
inputFields.description: The number of characters to return in addition to the keyword

types.name: SearchItemsContentType
types.description: A SavedItem can be one of these content types

types.name: SearchItemsSortBy
types.description: Enum to specify the sort by field (these are the current options, we could add more in the future)

enumValues.name: CREATED_AT
enumValues.description: Indicates when a SavedItem was created

enumValues.name: TIME_TO_READ
enumValues.description: Estimated time to read a SavedItem

enumValues.name: RELEVANCE
enumValues.description:
Sort SavedItems based on a relevance score
This is a feature of elasticsearch and current only available for premium search

types.name: SearchItemsSortOrder
types.description: Enum to specify the sort order of user items fetched

types.name: SearchItemsStatusFilter
types.description: Valid statuses a client may use to filter

types.name: SearchParams
types.description: Input field for search

inputFields.name: term
inputFields.description: The keyword to search for

inputFields.name: filters
inputFields.description: Filters to be applied to the search

inputFields.name: sort
inputFields.description: Sorting for the search

inputFields.name: from
inputFields.description: Offset for pagination

inputFields.name: size
inputFields.description: Number of items to return

inputFields.name: fields
inputFields.description: Fields to search for the keyword in

inputFields.name: highlightFields
inputFields.description: Fields that should be highlighted if keywords are found within them

inputFields.name: functionalBoosts
inputFields.description: Operation to boost the score of a document based

types.name: SearchResult
types.description: The return type for the search query

fields.name: totalResults
fields.description: Number of items found

fields.name: results
fields.description: Items found

types.name: SearchSort
types.description: Input field for sorting items

inputFields.name: field
inputFields.description: Field in elasticsearch to sort by

inputFields.name: direction
inputFields.description: Direction of the sort (ASC/DESC)

types.name: SearchSortDirection
types.description: Sort direction of the returned items.

inputFields.name: sortBy
inputFields.description: The field by which to sort user items

inputFields.name: sortOrder
inputFields.description: The order in which to sort user items

types.name: SearchStatus
types.description:
An index item can be in one of these states
QUEUED implies an item that has not been archived

types.name: Slate
types.description: A grouping of item recommendations that relate to each other under a specific name and description

fields.name: requestId
fields.description: A guid that is unique to every API request that returned slates, such as `getSlateLineup` or `getSlate`. The API will provide a new request id every time apps hit the API.

fields.name: experimentId
fields.description: A unique guid/slug, provided by the Data & Learning team that can identify a specific experiment. Production apps typically won't request a specific one, but can for QA or during a/b testing.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: The name to show to the user for this set of recommendations

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the the slate

fields.name: recommendations
fields.description: An ordered list of the recommendations to show to the user

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique slug/id that describes a SlateLineup. The Data & Learning team will provide apps what id to use here for specific cases.

fields.name: requestId
fields.description: A guid that is unique to every API request that returned slates, such as `getRecommendationSlateLineup` or `getSlate`. The API will provide a new request id every time apps hit the API.

fields.name: slates
fields.description: An ordered list of slates for the client to display

fields.name: experimentId
fields.description: A unique guid/slug, provided by the Data & Learning team that can identify a specific experiment. Production apps typically won't request a specific one, but can for QA or during a/b testing.

types.name: Surface
types.description:
Union type to reference a surface
This is a future improvement, not needed now.

types.name: SyndicatedArticle
types.description: An article that Pocket has syndicated and we also host on our own site

fields.name: content
fields.description: Content for the syndicated article

fields.name: slug
fields.description: Slug that pocket uses for this article in the url

fields.name: originalItemId
fields.description: The item id of the article we cloned

fields.name: itemId
fields.description: The item id of this Syndicated Article

fields.name: status
fields.description:
DRAFT — Article is not meant to be available to the public
EXPIRED — Article contract is up and should be redirected to original article
ACTIVE — Article is clear to be shown in syndicated form

fields.name: showAds
fields.description: Should ads be shown on this article or not

fields.name: publisher
fields.description: The manually set publisher information for this article

fields.name: authorNames
fields.description: Array of author names in string format

fields.name: expiresAt
fields.description: When does the contract for syndication expire

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of syndicated article

fields.name: excerpt
fields.description: Excerpt

fields.name: publishedAt
fields.description: AWSDateTime — Format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ

fields.name: mainImage
fields.description: Primary image to use in surfacing this content

fields.name: localeLanguage
fields.description: The language of the article

fields.name: localeCountry
fields.description: The locale country of the article

fields.name: iabTopCategory
fields.description: The Main IAB category of the article defined at https://support.aerserv.com/hc/en-us/articles/207148516-List-of-IAB-Categories

fields.name: iabSubCategory
fields.description: The Sub IAB category of the article defined at https://support.aerserv.com/hc/en-us/articles/207148516-List-of-IAB-Categories

fields.name: curationCategory
fields.description: The pocket curation category of the Article, maps to the Pocket Curation Topic lists

fields.name: topic
fields.description: The pocket topic of the Article, maps to the Pocket Curation Topic lists

fields.description: The actual tag string the user created for their list

fields.description: Surrogate primary key. This is usually generated by clients, but will be generated by the server if not passed through creation

fields.name: _createdAt

fields.name: _updatedAt
fields.description: Unix timestamp of when the entity was last updated, if any property on the entity is modified this timestamp is set to the modified time

fields.name: _version

fields.name: _deletedAt
fields.description: Unix timestamp of when the entity was deleted, 30 days after this date this entity will be HARD deleted from the database and no longer exist

types.name: TagConnection

fields.name: edges

inputFields.name: id

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The updated tag string

types.name: Timestamp
types.description: Integer based represention of a unix timestamp

types.name: Topic
types.description:
Represents a topic for /explore
Deprecated for SlateLineups

fields.name: id
fields.description: The id of the topic

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the topic to show to the user

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: The name of the topic to show to the user
fields.deprecationReason: displayName is deprecated. Use name instead.

fields.name: pageType
fields.description: The type of page this topic represents used in  generation

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The slug that should be used in the url to represent the topic

fields.name: query
fields.description: The query that was used internally for elasticsearch to find items

fields.name: curatorLabel
fields.description: The label the curator uses internally to get items onto this topic

fields.name: isDisplayed
fields.description: Whether or not clients should show this topic ot users

fields.name: isPromoted
fields.description: Whether or not this topic should be visiblly promoted (prominent on the page)

fields.name: displayNote
fields.description: If returned a note to show to the user about the topic

fields.name: socialTitle
fields.description: The title to use in the HTML markup for SEO and social media sharing

fields.name: socialDescription
fields.description: The description to use in the HTML markup for SEO and social media sharing

fields.name: socialImage
fields.description: The image to use in the HTML markup for SEO and social media sharing

fields.name: customFeedId
fields.description: The internal feed id that this topic will pull from if set

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The id of the topic

types.name: UnleashAssignment
types.description: Details on the variant/status of this toggle for a given user/context

fields.name: name
fields.description: The unleash toggle name, the same name as it appears in the admin interface and feature api

fields.name: assigned
fields.description: Whether or not the provided context is assigned

fields.name: variant
fields.description: If the toggle has variants, the variant name it is assigned to

fields.name: payload
fields.description: If the variant has a payload, its payload value

types.name: UnleashAssignmentList
types.description: Contains a list of all toggles.

types.name: UnleashContext
types.description:
Information about the user and device. Based on https://unleash.github.io/docs/unleash_context

Used to calculate assignment values.

inputFields.name: appName
inputFields.description:
A unique name for one of our apps. Can be any string, but here are some known/expected values:

- `android`
- `ios`
- `web-discover`
- `web-app`

inputFields.name: environment
inputFields.description:
The environment the device is running in:
- `prod`
- `beta`
- `alpha`

inputFields.name: userId
inputFields.description: If logged in, the user's encoded user id (uid). The {Account.user_id}.

inputFields.name: sessionId
inputFields.description: A device specific identifier that will be consistent across sessions, typically the encoded {guid} or some session token.

inputFields.name: remoteAddress
inputFields.description: The device's IP address. If omitted, inferred from either request header `x-forwarded-for` or the origin IP of the request.

enumValues.name: prod
enumValues.description: User facing, production builds

enumValues.name: beta
enumValues.description: User facing, beta level builds

enumValues.name: alpha
enumValues.description: Internal team builds

types.name: UnleashProperties
types.description: Extended properties that Unleash can use to assign users through a toggle's strategies.

inputFields.name: locale
inputFields.description: If omitted, inferred from request header `accept-langauge`.

inputFields.name: accountCreatedAt
inputFields.description: Only required on activation strategies that are based on account age

inputFields.name: recItUserProfile
inputFields.description: Only required on activation strategies that are based whether a user model exists

types.name: UnMarseable
types.description: Represents content that could not be parsed into a valid Marticle* component.

fields.name: html
fields.description: The html that could not be parsed into a Marticle* component.

inputFields.name: preferredTopics
inputFields.description: Topics that the user expressed interest in.

types.name: Url
types.description: A String in the format of a url.

fields.name: id
fields.description: User id, provided by the user service.

fields.name: savedItems
fields.description: Get a general paginated listing of all SavedItems for the user

fields.name: tags
fields.description: Get a paginated listing of all a user's Tags

fields.name: savedItemById
fields.description: Get a SavedItem by its id

fields.name: recommendationPreferences
fields.description: Preferences for recommendations that the user has explicitly set.

fields.name: avatarUrl
fields.description: The public avatar url for the user

fields.name: username
fields.description: The public username for the user

fields.name: name
fields.description: The users first name and last name combined

fields.name: description
fields.description: A users bio for their profile

fields.name: isPremium
fields.description: The user's premium status

fields.name: search
fields.description: Premium search query. Name will be updated after client input

fields.name: searchSavedItems
fields.description: Get a paginated list of user items that match a given term

fields.name: preferredTopics
fields.description: Topics that the user expressed interest in.

types.name: Video
types.description: A Video, typically within an Article View of an {Item} or if the Item is a video itself.

fields.name: height
fields.description: If known, the height of the video in px

fields.name: src
fields.description: Absolute url to the video

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of video

fields.name: vid
fields.description: The video's id within the service defined by type

fields.name: videoId
fields.description: The id of the video within Article View. {articleView.article} will have placeholders of <div id='RIL_VID_X' /> where X is this id. Apps can download those images as needed and populate them in their article view.

fields.name: width
fields.description: If known, the width of the video in px

fields.name: length
fields.description: If known, the length of the video in seconds

enumValues.name: NO_VIDEOS
enumValues.description: No videos (v3 value is 0)

enumValues.name: HAS_VIDEOS
enumValues.description: Contains videos (v3 value is 1)

enumValues.name: IS_VIDEO
enumValues.description: Is a video (v3 value is 2)

enumValues.name: YOUTUBE
enumValues.description: Youtube (v3 value is 1)

enumValues.name: VIMEO_LINK
enumValues.description: Vimeo Link (v3 value is 2)

enumValues.name: VIMEO_MOOGALOOP
enumValues.description: Vimeo Moogaloop (v3 value is 3)

enumValues.name: VIMEO_IFRAME
enumValues.description: video iframe (v3 value is 4)

enumValues.description: html5 (v3 value is 5)

enumValues.description: Flash (v3 value is 6)

enumValues.name: BRIGHTCOVE
enumValues.description: Brightcove (v3 value is 8)

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
